intro: Tragia paraguariensis var. canescens, commonly known as the Paraguayan spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Paraguay and Brazil. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy, ribbed stems and alternate leaves. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in complex structures called cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and agricultural fields.
